name: corroboree
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a meeting of Australian Aboriginal people that usually includes traditional music and dancing. The meeting can be a sacred (= holy) ceremony, a celebration, a social event, etc.: Until European settlement, groups would gather here to socialize, feast, and have corroborees.
Australian English a party or celebration: There will be one huge corroboree in Canberra tonight after that result.
More examplesFewer examplesThe point at the river mouth may have been used for corroborees; today it's a picnic area and campsite.The dance ceremony is called a corroboree.He was invited to a corroboree.The traditional Ngunnawal and Ngambri peoples used what is now modern-day Canberra to hold their corroborees.
